DOC.brief_summary: This study recruit 316 ischemic stroke patient take aspirin . They randomly assign cilostazol group placebo group . Every patient take 200mg cilostazol day placebo 1 month . The primary outcome variable study rate biochemical aspirin resistance Ultra Rapid Platelet Function Assay-ASA .
DOC.brief_title: Overcome Biochemical Aspirin Resistance Through Cilostazol Combination
DOC.detailed_description: [ Goal ] To reveal effect safety additional cilostazol overcome biochemical aspirin resistance . [ Trial Design ] Double-Blind , Placebo-Controlled , Randomized , Multicenter Trial [ Participants ] Ischemic stroke patient take aspirin [ Methods ] - Double-Blind , Placebo-Controlled , Randomized , Multicenter Trial - Investigational product : Cilostazol 200mg ( 100mg twice per day ) - Concomitant medication : Aspirin 100 mg per day - Medication Duration : 1 month [ Outcome Variables ] Primary Outcome Variable : • proportion patient aspirin reaction unit ( ARUs ) value ≥550 Ultra Rapid Platelet Function Assay-ASA Secondary outcome variable : - proportion patient ARUs value ≥500 Ultra Rapid Platelet Function Assay-ASA - ARUs value - Bleeding time ( BT ) - Fatal major bleed complication - Any bleeding complication
DOC.criteria: Symptomatic cerebral infarction document MRI CT More 35 year age Patients take aspirin 100mg day 2 week randomization Patients take antiplatelets aspirin within 2 week randomization Patients take anticoagulant within 2 week randomization Patients take thrombolytic therapy within 2 week randomization Patients take NSAIDs within 2 week randomization Patients need take NSAIDs regularly ( e.g . rheumatic arthritis ) .
